meanings.definition: A person who hesitates or refuses to proceed with an action.
meanings.sent1: The balker stood frozen, unsure of what to do next.
meanings.sent2: The team couldn't move forward because of the balker's indecision.
meanings.sent3: The balker's hesitation to jump into the pool was comical.
meanings.sent4: Her mind turned into a balker, blocking any progress.
meanings.sent5: The image of a balker at the crossroads stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To stop short and refuse to go on.
meanings.sent1: She would often balker at the edge of the cliff, afraid to take the leap.
meanings.sent2: The horse suddenly balked at the sight of the water ahead.
meanings.sent3: The car seemed to balker at the idea of climbing the steep hill.
meanings.sent4: His courage balked at the thought of facing his fears.
meanings.sent5: The engine balkered, refusing to start on the cold morning.

meanings.definition: To refuse to work or act.
meanings.sent1: The machine would balker every time we tried to use it.
meanings.sent2: He would often balker when asked to help with chores.
meanings.sent3: The computer decided to balker right before the important presentation.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity seemed to balker when faced with the blank canvas.
meanings.sent5: The old car would balker on rainy days, refusing to start.
